Package neureka.devices

Interface Device<V>

Type Parameters:
V - The value type of super type of the values stored on a Device implementation...
All Superinterfaces:
Component<Tsr<V>>, java.lang.Iterable<Tsr<V>>, Storage<V>
All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractBaseDevice, AbstractDevice, CPU, FileDevice, OpenCLDevice
public interface Device<V>
extends Component<Tsr<V>>, Storage<V>, java.lang.Iterable<Tsr<V>>
Implementations of this represent computational devices for storing tensors (instances of the Tsr<V> class), which may also expose a useful API for executing operations on tensors. Such instances are also components of tensors, which is why this interface extends the Component<Tsr<V>> interface.

The device interface extends the "Storage" interface because devices are capable of storing tensors on them. A tensor stored on a device holds a reference to that device, as well as the device itself which may also know about the tensors it holds. A tensor stored on a device will have its "isOutsourced" property set to true!

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes 
    Modifier and Type Interface Description
    static interface  Device.In
    The second part of the method chain of the fluent API for executing tensors on this Device temporarily.

    Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface neureka.common.composition.Component

    Component.IsBeing, Component.OwnerChangeRequest<O>

  • Method Details

    • find

      static Device<?> find​(java.lang.String... searchKeys)
      This method returns Device instances matching the given search parameter.
      Parameters:
      searchKeys - The search parameter and name of the requested Device instance.
      Returns:
      The found Device instance or simply the CPU instance by default.

    • find

      static <T,​ D extends Device<T>> D find​(java.lang.Class<D> deviceType, java.lang.String... searchKeys)
      This method returns Device instances matching the given search parameters.
      Parameters:
      searchKeys - The search parameter and name of the requested Device instance.
      Returns:
      The found Device instance or simply the CPU instance by default.

    • dispose

      void dispose()
      This method signals the device to get ready for garbage collection. A given device may have resources which ought to be freed when it is no longer used. One may also choose to do resource freeing manually.

    • store

      <T extends V> Device<V> store​(Tsr<T> tensor, Tsr<T> parent)
      Implementations of this method ought to store the value of the given tensor and the "parent" tensor in whatever formant suites the underlying implementation and or final type. Device implementations are also tensor storages which may also have to store tensors which are slices of bigger tensors.

      Parameters:
      tensor - The tensor whose data ought to be stored.
      Returns:
      A reference this object to allow for method chaining. (factory pattern)

    • has

      <T extends V> boolean has​(Tsr<T> tensor)
      Use this to check if a tensor is stored on this Device!

      Type Parameters:
      T - The type parameter for the value type of the tensor, which must be supported by this Device.
      Parameters:
      tensor - The tensor which may or may not be stored on this Device.
      Returns:
      The truth value determining if the provided tensor is stored on this Device.

    • free

      <T extends V> Device<V> free​(Tsr<T> tensor)
      Use this to remove the provided tensor from this Device!

      Type Parameters:
      T - The type parameter for the value type of the tensor, which must be supported by this Device.
      Parameters:
      tensor - The tensor which ought to be removed from this Device.
      Returns:
      This very instance to allow for method chaining.

    • cleaning

      <T extends V> Device<V> cleaning​(Tsr<T> tensor, java.lang.Runnable action)
      Use this to perform some custom memory cleanup for when the provided Tsr gets garbage collected.

      Type Parameters:
      T - The type parameter for the value type of the tensor, which must be supported by this Device.
      Parameters:
      tensor - The tensor for which a Runnable lambda ought to be executed upon garbage collection.
      action - The Runnable action which ought to be performed when the tensor gets garbage collected.
      Returns:
      This very instance to allow for method chaining.

    • write

      <T extends V> Device<V> write​(Tsr<T> tensor, java.lang.Object value)
      Use this method to write data to the provided tensor, given that the tensor is already stored on this device!

      Type Parameters:
      T - The type parameter for the value type of the tensor, which must be supported by this Device.
      Parameters:
      tensor - The tensor whose underlying data array ought to be written to.
      value - The data inn the form of a primitive array.
      Returns:
      This very instance to allow for method chaining.

    • swap

      <T extends V> Device<V> swap​(Tsr<T> former, Tsr<T> replacement)
      This method is used internally mostly and should not be used in most cases.

      Type Parameters:
      T - The type parameter for the value type of the tensors, which must be supported by this Device.
      Parameters:
      former - The tensor whose associated data (on the device) ought to be assigned to the other tensor.
      replacement - The tensor which ought to receive the data of the former tensor internally.
      Returns:
      This very instance to allow for method chaining.

    • approve

      Device<V> approve​(ExecutionCall<? extends Device<?>> call)
      This method is used internally to give Device implementations the opportunity to perform some exception handling before the ExecutionCall will be dispatched. Use this for debugging when doing custom backend operations.
      Parameters:
      call - The ExecutionCall which should be approved by this Device before execution.
      Returns:
      This very instance to allow for method chaining.

    • updateNDConf

      <T extends V> Device<V> updateNDConf​(Tsr<T> tensor)
      This method automatically called within the AbstractNDArray.setNDConf(NDConfiguration) method so that an outsourced tensor has a consistent ND-Configuration both in RAM and on any given Device implementation...

      Type Parameters:
      T - The type parameter for the value type of the tensor, which must be supported by this Device.
      Parameters:
      tensor - The tensor whose NDConfiguration should be resent to this Device.
      Returns:
      This very instance to allow for method chaining.

      Operation optimizedOperationOf​(Function function, java.lang.String name)

    • optimizedFunctionOf

      default Function optimizedFunctionOf​(Function function, java.lang.String name)

    • use

      default Device.In use​(Tsr<V> first, Tsr<V>... rest)
      This is a very simple fluent API for temporarily storing a number of tensors on this Device, executing a provided lambda action, and then migrating all the tensors back to their original devices.

      Parameters:
      first - The first tensor among all passed tensors which ought to be stored temporarily on this Device.
      rest - Any number of other tensors passed to this method to be stored temporarily on this Device.
      Returns:
      A simple lambda runner which will migrate the tensors passed to this method to this very Device, execute the provided lambda, and then migrate all the tensors back to their original devices!
